title: What Does IDM Mean? Snapchat, Texting, and More

steps.title: I Don’t Mind.
steps.content: I Don’t Mind. “IDM” is a quick, easy way for someone to show their flexibility, ambivalence, or agreement to something. It’s a pretty commonly used slang word, so you’ve probably seen it around on Snapchat and other social media platforms, like Twitter. [1] X Research source

steps.title: It Doesn’t Matter.
steps.content: It Doesn’t Matter. For all intents and purposes, “It Doesn’t Matter” means the exact same thing as “I Don’t Mind.” Both definitions can be used interchangeably! [2] X Research source

steps.title: Let someone know that you’re flexible.
steps.content: Let someone know that you’re flexible. Is your friend asking to borrow your Hulu login again, or is your mom asking you for a quick favor when she’s out of the house? “IDM” is a great way to go with the flow and let someone know that you’re fine with whatever they’re suggesting. Mom: “I’m picking up some sandwiches for dinner. Is it okay if there are pickles on yours?” You: “Yeah, IDM” Friend: “Is it cool if I stop by your place for a sec? I think I left my textbook there.” You: “Sure thing! IDM.” Friend: “Sorry, I’m running a little. Are you cool waiting in the car for me?” You: “Yeah, IDM. Take your time!”

steps.title: Use it as shorthand for the words I don’t mind.
steps.content: Use it as shorthand for the words I don’t mind . About to send a new tweet? Save some characters by abbreviating the words “I don’t mind” as “IDM.” This tip works for texts, photo captions, and all other types of social media, too! “IDM shopping local at the farmer’s market but I wish all the produce wasn’t rotten 😩” “IDM pineapple on pizza. I really don’t get what all of the drama is about 🤔” “Who cares about the ticket prices? IDM paying extra if it means I can get good seats.”

steps.title: Thank them if they’re doing you a favor.
steps.content: Thank them if they’re doing you a favor. Let them know that you appreciate their flexibility, and that you’re happy to return the favor someday if you can. You: “Do you mind watching my cat this weekend?” Friend: "Sure, IDM." You: “Thanks so much! You’re a lifesaver.” You: “Would you mind filling the car up before you head home tonight?” Dad: “Yeah, IDM. The gas station is on my way home” You: “Thanks a million! I’ll pay you back later.”

steps.title: Leave the message unanswered if it ends the conversation.
steps.content: Leave the message unanswered if it ends the conversation. “IDM” can work in a lot of different scenarios, including quick conversations. If you’re quickly confirming something with a friend or loved one, you might not need to reply to “IDM” at all. You: “Can we meet at 8:00 instead of 7:30?” Them: “Yeah, IDM.”

steps.title: Send it in casual messages to friends and close loved ones.
steps.content: Send it in casual messages to friends and close loved ones. “IDM” is a great way to spice up your usual texts and Snapchat messages, but only save it for casual occasions and conversations. If you’re writing to your boss or manager, write out “I don’t mind” or “It doesn’t matter” rather than sending “IDM.” [3] X Research source

steps.title: Intelligent Dance Music:
steps.content: Intelligent Dance Music: Chatting with friends about music? In this case, “IDM” might actually refer to “Intelligent Dance Music,” a lesser-known genre that first appeared in the early 90s. [4] X Research source Unlike more popular dance music genres, IDM focuses on breaking the mold and building a musical atmosphere. [5] X Research source You can still find IDM fans online if you poke around in the right corners of the internet. Check out albums like Selected Ambient Works 85-92 by Aphex Twin and Music Has the Right to Children by Boards of Canada if you’d like to give this subgenre a try. [6] X Research source

steps.title: Internet Download Manager:
steps.content: Internet Download Manager: Spot the word “IDM” while browsing the internet? In some parts of the tech world, “IDM” stands for Internet Download Manager, a premium software that claims to speed up and optimize your internet downloads. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Stay on top of new texting slang with these common acronyms.
steps.content: Stay on top of new texting slang with these common acronyms. Learn these popular slang terms to stay in the know and keep your texts looking like English instead of gibberish: BSF : “Best sister friend” or “best sibling friend” MMK : “Mmkay” (a combo of “mm” and “okay”) HB : “Heartbroken,” “homeboy,” or “how ‘bout?” DL : “Down low” ABS : “Absolutely” WYLL : “What you look like” or “What do you look like?” HYB : “How you been?” ISTG : “I swear to God”
